The Project Manager is in charge of a range of projects undertaken by the organisation,and is responsible for ensuring complete product delivery and handover according to respective project scope specifications and standards. He/She plays a strategic role in managing the organisation's many projects,and is responsible for defining project scopes, objectives, plans and performance measuring criteria to ensure the completion of project deliverables according to required standards and client expectations. He/She also leads project reviews to identify synergies and areas of improvements across the portfolio of projects.

The Project Manager should be comfortable engaging and interacting with both internal and external parties, to manage key strategic stakeholder communication and negotiations.

Develop, validate, release SOC level automotive microcontroller test program for Intelligent Burn In System( IBIS), meeting the required test time, test coverage and yeild. Ensure continuous improvement on test program to achieve better test coverage , shorter test time and robust test operation. Support troubleshooting and debugging of software and hardware for burn in test related problems. Support Burn In Board development and validation. Ensure continuous improvement on development process and methodologies.


  • 3-5 years of experience in burn in/ test development
  • Knowledge on Burn in Board/test hardware design and debug.
  • Proficient with programming languages VB.NET, C#, MySQL.
  • Familiar with object-oriented programming paradigm.
  • Knowledge of software automation ( Jenkins), development environment( Visual Studio), and version control System( SVN,GIT).
  • Knowledge of microcontroller and embedded SRAM/Flash test development.
  • Experience working with BE production test team on new product introduction is preferred.

· Develop and maintain software applications for payment systems

  • Responsible for management and resolution of Cell associates' grievances and disciplinary issues.
  • Manage attendance and leave schedule of Cell associates.
  • Conduct annual performance review for Cell associates.

  • Constantly tweak and improve these processes to match a changing and growing company environment
  • Build an incredible team. Identify the skills needed to fulfill product roadmap and recruit product managers possessing those skills.
  • Mentor your reports and enable them to constantly improve and reach their long-term goals
  • Give clarity of purpose and generate energy for your team

This role reports to the Regional Claims Technical Services Manager who has in charge 4 areas: Vendor Management, Recovery, Fraud and Quality.The main responsibilities will be to primarly support 2 areas: Vendor Management and Recovery in terms of data analysis, systems, processes etc.

The position will be responsible for the analysis and reporting of Asia Pacific's Claims Vendor Management and Recovery key business metrics, KPIs, spend analytics across all lines of business. This position is also required to assist in country stakeholders in using procurement platforms and tools, as well as the preparation of presentation materials to senior management and provide the business with relevant information/reports to support business decisions.

In addition this role will also provide Business Analysis to various ongoing projects and new initiatives.

Vendor Management support
- Support in scoping together with the Business, Business requirements and size of the initiave
- Provide spend data analysis
- Support due diligence process (use of the tools, engage with external and internal stakeholders)

Recovery support
- Support in scoping out Business Requirements
- Engage with all countries to understand reports needs and how they can be built and automated
- Generate monthly reports

Business Analysis
- Produce written documentation to support your work, report on your findings and to present to stakeholders when necessary.
- Be responsible for understanding, analysing and interpreting business requirements and needs, liaising with key stakeholders to ensure that deliverables meet the needs of internal departments.
- Prepare requirement analysis and business cases for new projects.

Requirements:

· Experience in Business analytics
· Experience in Insurance industry will be preferred
· Experience in Claims Operations/ Vendor Management across multiple vendor categories would be preferred.
· Knowledge of Claims vendors and vendor market would be preferred


  • 3-5 years of experience in burn in/ test development
  • Knowledge on Burn in Board/test hardware design and debug.
  • Proficient with programming languages VB.NET, C#, MySQL.
  • Familiar with object-oriented programming paradigm.
  • Knowledge of software automation ( Jenkins), development environment( Visual Studio), and version control System( SVN,GIT).
  • Knowledge of microcontroller and embedded SRAM/Flash test development.
  • Experience working with BE production test team on new product introduction is preferred.

  • Support functional lead for CWS (our customer portal) and is responsible to analyze processes and best practices among work-streams to ensure the system is delivered with maximize synergies, quality and efficiencies.
  • Support delivery manager closely in areas requiring systems and business domain knowledge.

column4: Research Associate Analyst, Financial Sector - Singapore
column8:
Join a high performing equities research team with momentum in Asia. With an entrepreneurial culture, Macquarie has one of the global financial services industry's top performing profitability, growth and shareholder returns.


As the successful candidate, you will have a tertiary qualification in a quantitative, math, finance or accounting discipline. You should have prior experience gained from equity research area, and some experience in supporting a lead sell-side analyst covering financial stocks (banking/exchanges). You are numerically inclined, with financial analysis, math and accounting skills. Your exceptional communication skills will support you in building good relationships with clients and we appreciate you will enjoy communicating at all levels with the sales team. Python and equivalent skills is a plus and lastly you are fluent in English.

The Project Manager is in charge of a range of projects undertaken by the organisation,and is responsible for ensuring complete product delivery and handover according to respective project scope specifications and standards. He/She plays a strategic role in managing the organisation's many projects,and is responsible for defining project scopes, objectives, plans and performance measuring criteria to ensure the completion of project deliverables according to required standards and client expectations. He/She also leads project reviews to identify synergies and areas of improvements across the portfolio of projects.

The Project Manager should be comfortable engaging and interacting with both internal and external parties, to manage key strategic stakeholder communication and negotiations.

This role reports to the Regional Claims Technical Services Manager who has in charge 4 areas: Vendor Management, Recovery, Fraud and Quality.The main responsibilities will be to primarly support 2 areas: Vendor Management and Recovery in terms of data analysis, systems, processes etc.

The position will be responsible for the analysis and reporting of Asia Pacific's Claims Vendor Management and Recovery key business metrics, KPIs, spend analytics across all lines of business. This position is also required to assist in country stakeholders in using procurement platforms and tools, as well as the preparation of presentation materials to senior management and provide the business with relevant information/reports to support business decisions.

In addition this role will also provide Business Analysis to various ongoing projects and new initiatives.

Vendor Management support
- Support in scoping together with the Business, Business requirements and size of the initiave
- Provide spend data analysis
- Support due diligence process (use of the tools, engage with external and internal stakeholders)

Recovery support
- Support in scoping out Business Requirements
- Engage with all countries to understand reports needs and how they can be built and automated
- Generate monthly reports

Business Analysis
- Produce written documentation to support your work, report on your findings and to present to stakeholders when necessary.
- Be responsible for understanding, analysing and interpreting business requirements and needs, liaising with key stakeholders to ensure that deliverables meet the needs of internal departments.
- Prepare requirement analysis and business cases for new projects.

Requirements:

· Experience in Business analytics
· Experience in Insurance industry will be preferred
· Experience in Claims Operations/ Vendor Management across multiple vendor categories would be preferred.
· Knowledge of Claims vendors and vendor market would be preferred


  • 3-5 years of experience in burn in/ test development
  • Knowledge on Burn in Board/test hardware design and debug.
  • Proficient with programming languages VB.NET, C#, MySQL.
  • Familiar with object-oriented programming paradigm.
  • Knowledge of software automation ( Jenkins), development environment( Visual Studio), and version control System( SVN,GIT).
  • Knowledge of microcontroller and embedded SRAM/Flash test development.
  • Experience working with BE production test team on new product introduction is preferred.

column4: Research Associate Analyst, Financial Sector - Singapore
column8:
Join a high performing equities research team with momentum in Asia. With an entrepreneurial culture, Macquarie has one of the global financial services industry's top performing profitability, growth and shareholder returns.


As the successful candidate, you will have a tertiary qualification in a quantitative, math, finance or accounting discipline. You should have prior experience gained from equity research area, and some experience in supporting a lead sell-side analyst covering financial stocks (banking/exchanges). You are numerically inclined, with financial analysis, math and accounting skills. Your exceptional communication skills will support you in building good relationships with clients and we appreciate you will enjoy communicating at all levels with the sales team. Python and equivalent skills is a plus and lastly you are fluent in English.

column3: DAIMLER FINANCIAL SERVICES AFRICA & ASIA PACIFIC LTD.
column8:
Business Process Experts with strong retail & corporate banking knowledge provide the process expertise in areas of Wholesale Administration to the NextGen Project and thus for the implementation in 12 markets of the AAP region.
- Define, gather and consolidate business requirements and finalizing the scope for functionalities;
- Analyze and coordinate the impact on the required corporate policies and initiate change in the respective wholesale management system all under consideration of the internal control environment.
- Communicate with NextGen management as well as stakeholders to provide updates on project status for area of responsibility;
- Act as a change agent for the new technological backbone of the AAP region.
- Based in Singapore, but regular travelling to respective NextGen market projects is required.

Working closely with the Head of Claims Performance and Development the IPA Business Analyst is responsible for working with business owners to source automation projects, overseeing the documentation and re-engineering of those processes to support development of automation and serving as a liaison between the project team and the business. Qualified candidates must have a demonstrated track record of partnering with business stakeholder to understand, document, and improve existing processes ideally to support technical implementations.

On a day to day basis the role has overall responsibility for driving business analysis and requirement-gathering workshops during all phases of our IPA projects. Work with business stakeholders to understand the productivity impact of automation and calculate financial impact/return on investment. Oversee current state process capture, recommend and implement process re-engineering to support automation, and Use Case creation. Help develop and document detailed requirements for our to be processes, monitor progress and ensure successful delivery. You will also be responsible for regular reporting and analysis.

- Be responsible for understanding, analysing and interpreting business requirements and needs, liaising with key stakeholders to ensure that deliverables meet the needs of both internal departments and end users.
- Prepare requirement analysis and business cases for new projects, for both systems and processes.
- Develop project scope documents including but not limited to Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's), functional specifications, test scripts and cases etc.
- Think outside of the box to support the business in delivering its strategic objectives rather than just responding to a pre-defined request.
- Work closely with other business areas as required (Digital/IT/Business Partners/SME's) to understand interdependencies and associated pipeline and priorities for projects.

Requirements:
" 5+ years as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
" Experience in insurance industry will be preferred
" Project management experience will be preferred
" Excellent knowledge of online trends and Automation development, and a passion for all things related to Automation
" Knowledge of project mapping and change management process
" Preferred: Experienced in directly communicating with and managing expectations of both internal and external executive stakeholders.
" Preferred: Exposure to modern RPA platforms (E.g. Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, UI Path, Pega Robotics, WorkFusion)
" Preferred: Familiarity with the use of Scrum Methodologies (i.e. sprint planning, sprint review, backlog management, transparency, inspection and adaptation)

- Oversee daily routine activities in the kitchen and serving area


- Minimum Bachelor Degree

The Project Manager is in charge of a range of projects undertaken by the organisation,and is responsible for ensuring complete product delivery and handover according to respective project scope specifications and standards. He/She plays a strategic role in managing the organisation's many projects,and is responsible for defining project scopes, objectives, plans and performance measuring criteria to ensure the completion of project deliverables according to required standards and client expectations. He/She also leads project reviews to identify synergies and areas of improvements across the portfolio of projects.

The Project Manager should be comfortable engaging and interacting with both internal and external parties, to manage key strategic stakeholder communication and negotiations.
